hero.core_tension: Decide between blanket markdowns that drive traffic but erode margin and a targeted collab-led store-as-studio approach that protects price and captures premium early-window buyers.
hero.setting: High-end store reconfigured as a small studio pop-up. Low camera angle, central operator, materials: brushed wood counter, matte metal fixtures, clean negative space.
hero.persona: Head of Retail visibly choosing the collab-led, store-as-studio approach over blanket discounts.
hero.action: Placing a partner fixture and signing a short-form trust guarantee for a narrow set of premium SKUs while a small schedule card shows Nov 21–Dec 05.
hero.urgency_symbol: Backlit calendar edge and a single illuminated shelf tile that signals the narrow early-window timing.
props: compact event schedule card referencing Nov 21–Dec 05
hero.lighting: Polished editorial lighting with confident highlights and controlled shadows; clean negative space around the operator.
hero.alt: Head of Retail executing collab-led store-as-studio pilot to capture early-window premium buyers

signal_map.structure: Concentric arcs and radial lanes forming a measurement spine. Inner arc encodes early-window share; outer arc encodes cumulative footfall lift. Lattice nodes mark CPA thresholds.
signal_map.motion: Flow from partner nodes across lanes into premium SKU tokens, with density spikes showing expected footfall lift and a dashed path indicating conversion concentration during Nov 21–Dec 05.
signal_map.palette: Muted neutrals with two confident accents: deep teal for early-window share and warm amber for footfall lift; materials suggest matte paper and frosted glass.
signal_map.alt: CMO reviewing measurement spine visualizing footfall lift, early-window share and CPA targets

case_studies.scene: Close-up editorial shot of a premium shelf cluster with trust overlays. Linen provenance tags and a third-party quality badge are foreground. Composition: shallow depth, tight crop on label materials.
case_studies.moment: Head of Merch compares two identical SKUs: one with a trust kit (guarantee, provenance, fast returns) and one with a standard markdown. The operator watches a compact analytics card showing conversion lift.
case_studies.persona: Head of Merch running an A/B pilot of trust overlays versus markdowns.
case_studies.lighting: Soft, confident highlights on product surfaces; editorial contrast to make tags legible.
case_studies.alt: Head of Merch testing trust-overlay premium SKUs versus markdowns to raise conversion

case_studies.scene: Wide editorial framing of a partner pop-up inside a store-as-studio. Mid-angle, operator engaging with a partner rep while visitors scan a QR cluster. Materials: plywood stage, matte fabric backdrops, printed schedule cards.
case_studies.moment: Head of Partnerships finalizes a pop-up layout while staff places visible QR callouts and a small partner value placard. Movement suggests incoming footfall and quick scans.
case_studies.persona: Head of Partnerships piloting a collab-led pop-up to drive traffic without increasing promo spend.
props: compact schedule referencing the Nov 21–Dec 05 window
case_studies.lighting: Bright, even editorial light with confident rim highlights on operators and QR areas.
case_studies.alt: Head of Partnerships piloting a partner pop-up to lift footfall and QR redemptions
